verses.verse: For the director.[b] With flutes. A psalm of David.
Listen to my words, O LORD; pay heed to my sighs.
Hear my cry for help, my King and my God; for to you I pray.
O LORD, at daybreak[c] you hear my voice; at daybreak I bring my petition before you and await your reply.
For you are not a God who delights in wickedness; evil cannot remain in your presence.
The arrogant shrink before your gaze; you hate all who do evil.
You destroy all who tell lies; the LORD detests the violent and the deceitful.
But I will enter your house because of your great kindness,[d] and I will bow down in your holy temple, filled with awe of you.
Lead me in your ways of righteousness, O LORD, for I am surrounded by enemies; make your path straight before me.[e]
For there is nothing trustworthy in their mouth;[f] their heart devises treacherous schemes. Their throat is a wide open grave; with their tongue they utter flattery.
Punish them, O God; may their intrigues result in their downfall. Cast them out because of their many transgressions, for they have rebelled against you.[g]
But may all who take refuge in you rejoice; may they shout for joy forever. Grant them your protection so that those who love your name[h] may rejoice in you.
